tool.name: qiime2 vsearch uchime-denovo
tool.description: De novo chimera filtering with vsearch.

param.name: sequences
param.label: sequences: FeatureData[Sequence]
param.help: [required] The feature sequences to be chimera-checked.

param.name: table
param.label: table: FeatureTable[Frequency]
param.help: [required] Feature table (used for computing total feature abundances).

param.name: dn
param.label: dn: Float % Range(0.0, None)
param.help: [default: 1.4] No vote pseudo-count, corresponding to the parameter n in the chimera scoring function.

param.name: mindiffs
param.label: mindiffs: Int % Range(1, None)
param.help: [default: 3] Minimum number of differences per segment.

param.name: minh
param.label: minh: Float % Range(0.0, 1.0, inclusive_end=True)
param.help: [default: 0.28] Minimum score (h). Increasing this value tends to reduce the number of false positives and to decrease sensitivity.

param.name: xn
param.label: xn: Float % Range(1.0, None, inclusive_start=False)
param.help: [default: 8.0] No vote weight, corresponding to the parameter beta in the scoring function.

tool.help:
QIIME 2: vsearch uchime-denovo ============================== De novo chimera filtering with vsearch.
Outputs: -------- :chimeras.qza: The chimeric sequences. :nonchimeras.qza: The non-chimeric sequences. :stats.qza: Summary statistics from chimera checking.
|
Description: ------------ Apply the vsearch uchime_denovo method to identify chimeric feature sequences. The results of this method can be used to filter chimeric features from the corresponding feature table. For additional details, please refer to the vsearch documentation.
|
